org.threadly.concurrent.limiter

Class SchedulerServiceLimiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.AbstractSubmitterExecutor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.ExecutorLimiter
        • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SimpleSchedulerLimiter
          • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SchedulerServiceLimiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SchedulerServiceInterface, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrioritySchedulerLimiter

    public class SchedulerServiceLimiter
extends SimpleSchedulerLimiter
implements SchedulerServiceInterface

    This class is designed to limit how much parallel execution happens on a provided SchedulerServiceInterface. This allows the implementor to have one thread pool for all their code, and if they want certain sections to have less levels of parallelism (possibly because those those sections would completely consume the global pool), they can wrap the executor in this class.

    Thus providing you better control on the absolute thread count and how much parallelism can occur in different sections of the program.

    This is an alternative from having to create multiple thread pools. By using this you also are able to accomplish more efficiently thread use than multiple thread pools would.

    This extends the SimpleSchedulerLimiter to add SchedulerServiceInterface features. This does not cause any performance hits, but does require a source SchedulerServiceInterface to rely on. If you have a SchedulerServiceInterface available this implementation should be prefered over the SimpleSchedulerLimiter.

    Since:
    2.0.0

        public SchedulerServiceLimiter(SchedulerServiceInterface scheduler,
                       int maxConcurrency)
        Constructs a new limiter that implements the SchedulerServiceInterface.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - SchedulerServiceInterface implementation to submit task executions to.
        maxConcurrency - maximum qty of runnables to run in parallel

      • SchedulerServiceLimiter

        public SchedulerServiceLimiter(SchedulerServiceInterface scheduler,
                       int maxConcurrency,
                       java.lang.String subPoolName)
        Constructs a new limiter that implements the SchedulerServiceInterface.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - SchedulerServiceInterface implementation to submit task executions to.
        maxConcurrency - maximum qty of runnables to run in parallel
        subPoolName - name to describe threads while tasks running in pool (null to not change thread names)

        Description copied from interface: SchedulerServiceInterface
